title: How to Make Salisbury Steak

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 350°F (176°C) and line a large casserole dish with aluminum foil.
Mix together in a large bowl the hamburger, onions, eggs, bread crumbs and dry seasonings.
Take a handful of the ground beef mixture and shape it into an oval patty, about 1” (2.54 cm) thick.
steps.description: This recipe should yield 6 large oval “steaks.”

steps.headline: Melt the butter in a skillet over medium heat.
Brown the Salisbury steaks.
steps.description: Don’t brown for more than 5 minutes on each side or you will overcook them.

steps.headline: Lift the patties out of the skillet with a slotted spoon.
steps.description: This will allow the grease to drain from the meat.

steps.headline: Transfer the patties to the foil lined pan.
Combine the soups, wine, Worcester sauce and brown gravy seasoning in a medium saucepan.
Heat the ingredients on medium-low heat for 15 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Pour the gravy over the Salisbury steaks.
Serve with mashed potatoes, rice or egg noodles.

text: Prepare the Steaks Preheat the oven to 350°F (176°C) and line a large casserole dish with aluminum foil.  Mix together in a large bowl the hamburger, onions, eggs, bread crumbs and dry seasonings.  Take a handful of the ground beef mixture and shape it into an oval patty, about 1” (2.54 cm) thick. This recipe should yield 6 large oval “steaks.” Melt the butter in a skillet over medium heat.  Brown the Salisbury steaks. Don’t brown for more than 5 minutes on each side or you will overcook them. Lift the patties out of the skillet with a slotted spoon. This will allow the grease to drain from the meat. Transfer the patties to the foil lined pan.  Prepare the Gravy Combine the soups, wine, Worcester sauce and brown gravy seasoning in a medium saucepan.  Heat the ingredients on medium-low heat for 15 minutes, stirring occasionally.  Pour the gravy over the Salisbury steaks.  Bake the steaks for 30 minutes.  Serve with mashed potatoes, rice or egg noodles.  Finished.
